result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

2:05. (12ct405, 13cf356, 13cm476, 14cf200, 14cm73, 14ct146) Defendant, Thomas M. Brewe,r in court, in custody with attorney Steven J. Luchsinger and attorney Greg E Vollan (14cm73).  Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews chrgs + pnlts w/ Deft.  Atty Klomberg heard --makes amendment to Ct. 1 in 14cf200 of MBJ.  Recess.  Case recalled 2:44  Atty Luchsinger heard.  Court heard.  


12ct405 = Court revokes DPA and finds Deft guilty
13cf356 = Deft pleads guilty to Ct. 1.  Court accepts plea (finds plea made f/v/k/i)  finds guilty and Ct. 2 is read in
13cm476 = case is read in for restitution $159.50
14cf200 = Deft pleads guilty to Cts. 1 + 2.  Court accepts plea (finds plea made f/v/k/i) finds guilty of Cts. 1 + 2 and restitution of $12.58
14cm73 = is read in for restituion $66.29
14ct146 = Deft pleads guilty to Ct. 1.  Court accepts plea (finds plea made f/v/k/i) finds guilty, dismisses Ct. 2 and reads in Ct. 3

 Atty Vollan heard + excused.  Atty Klomberg heard regarding PSI.  Atty Luchsinger heard.  Court heard and orders PSI done by 12/1/14.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Cases called - 12CT405, 13CF356, 13CM476, 14CF200, 14CM73, 14CT146.  Atty. Klomberg is heard, oldest cases are Branch 3 cases, they have set date in Branch 3 on October 17th, agreement has been reached to conclude all cases.  Parties to contact branch 1 if matters not concluded.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 25, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on August 28, 2014 at 11:00 am.
on Arraignment

Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prelim waived. Waiver reviewed. Argn held. Not guilty plea entered. TSC set.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not go on the premises at Wal-Mart, Beaver Dam, WI.

Defendant Thomas M. Brewer in custody via video with attorney Greg E Vollan (will appoint).  James T Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits.
